description: Warm up with a creamy spinach and paneer masala. Top off this comforting curry with pappadams fried in ghee for extra crunch and authentic flavour.
keywords: Indian curry,Pescatarian,Halal,Seafood free,Soy free,Wheat free,Gluten free,Egg free,Tomato,Spinach
name: Paneer masala with ghee and pappadams Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 0.75 cup unsalted cashews (plus extra chopped to serve)
400g paneer cheese, cut into 4 pieces each

recipeInstructions.text: Place cashews and 1 cup boiling water in a bowl. Stand for 10 minutes. Place cashew mixture in a food processor. Process until smooth.

Heat 1 tbs ghee in a large frying pan over high heat. Add half the paneer. Cook for 1 minute on each side or until light golden. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with another 1 tbs ghee and remaining paneer.

3 Heat 1 tbs remaining ghee in same pan over medium heat. Cook onion and garlic, stirring, for 2 minutes or until softened. Add cumin and cook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add paste, tomato, cashew mixture, paneer and 1/4 cup water, and bring to the boil. Simmer, uncovered, over mediumlow heat for 10 minutes or until sauce thickens slightly. Stir in 3/4 of the spinach.

Heat remaining ghee in a medium saucepan over high heat. Cook pappadams,1 at a time, for 5 seconds or until expanded and cooked through. Transfer to a paper towellined plate. Top curry with remaining spinach and extra cashews. Serve with pappadams.
